Quote: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Everything that we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injustice.
The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?
The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
Do not act as if you had ten thousand years to live. Death hangs over you. While you live, while it is in your power, be good.
How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinion than our own.
The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
Choose not to be harmed — and you won't feel harmed. Don't feel harmed — and you haven't been.
Confine yourself to the present.
It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
Don't seek to have events happen as you wish, but wish them to happen as they do happen, and your life will go smoothly.
No man is free who is not master of himself.
Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
Difficulties are things that show a person what they are.
Freedom is secured not by the fulfilling of one's desires, but by the removal of desire.
Know, first, who you are; and then adorn yourself accordingly.
How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
Only the educated are free.
The uneducated person accuses others; the partly educated person accuses themselves; the educated person accuses neither.
Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
Life is long, if you know how to use it.
Source: On the Shortness of Life, Seneca

Quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
Time heals what reason cannot.
While we are postponing, life speeds by.
There is no easy way from the earth to the stars.
If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
People are frugal in guarding their personal property; but when it comes to wasting time, they are most extravagant.
Source: On the Shortness of Life, Seneca

Quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
You have the right to work, but never to the fruit of the work.
Cold and heat, pleasure and pain arise from the contact of the senses with their objects. They are fleeting; endure them.
No one who does good work will ever come to a bad end, either here or in the world to come.
Man is made by his belief. As he believes, so he is.
Better to do one's own duty imperfectly than to do another's perfectly.
When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
Lust, anger, and greed are the three gates of hell leading to the ruin of the soul.
For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; for one who has failed to do so, the mind is the greatest enemy.
From anger comes delusion; from delusion, loss of memory; from loss of memory, the destruction of discernment; from the destruction of discernment, one is lost.
All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows him like a shadow that never leaves him.
Hatred is never appeased by hatred in this world. By non-hatred alone is hatred appeased. This is an eternal law.
Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace.
Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the wind, so the wise are not shaken by praise or blame.
Conquer anger by love, evil by good; conquer the miser by giving, and the liar by truth.
All tremble at violence; life is dear to all. Putting oneself in another's place, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.
If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.
All conditioned things are impermanent. When one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering.
As irrigators guide water to their fields, as archers aim their arrows, and as carpenters carve wood, the wise shape their minds.
What you do not wish for yourself, do not do to others.
When anger rises, think of the consequences.
Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
To study and not think is a waste. To think and not study is dangerous.
Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
To see what is right and not do it is a lack of courage.
When you have faults, do not fear to abandon them.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.
He who knows does not speak; he who speaks does not know.
Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
When you realize nothing is lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
Flow with whatever may happen, and let your mind be free: Stay centered by accepting whatever you are doing. This is the ultimate.
The frog in the well knows nothing of the great ocean.
The great man is he who does not lose his child's heart.
No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
Character is destiny.
Everything changes and nothing remains still.
The unexamined life is not worth living.
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Without friends, no one would choose to live, though he had all other goods.
You have made us for yourself, O Lord, and our hearts are restless until they rest in you.
Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe.
The heart has its reasons which reason knows nothing of.
All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone.
All things excellent are as difficult as they are rare.
I think, therefore I am.
Source: Discourse on the Method, René Descartes

Quote: If we have our own why of life, we shall get along with almost any how.
Source: Twilight of the Idols, Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: And if you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss also gazes into you.
Source: Beyond Good and Evil, Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: What does not kill me makes me stronger.
Source: Twilight of the Idols, Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Two things fill the mind with ever new and increasing admiration and awe, the more often and steadily we reflect upon them: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me.
Source: Critique of Practical Reason, Immanuel Kant

Quote: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
God does not burden any soul with more than it can bear.
Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
You are what your deep, driving desire is. As your desire is, so is your will. As your will is, so is your deed. As your deed is, so is your destiny.
If you want to make a man happy, do not add to his riches but take away from his desires.
Not what we have but what we enjoy constitutes our abundance.
Who is wise? One who learns from everyone.
Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.
In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.
Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.
Translation author: Fathers of the English Dominican Province

Quote: To study the self is to forget the self. To forget the self is to be enlightened by all things.
The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.
Wisdom begins in wonder.
Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
Courage is knowing what not to fear.
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise; seek what they sought.
When the student is ready, the teacher will appear.
Before enlightenment, chop wood, carry water. After enlightenment, chop wood, carry water.
There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
Source: Strength to Love, Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
Source: Letter from Birmingham Jail, Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: It is better to light a single candle than to curse the darkness.
And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.
